Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Steven P
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 nights, great vaule as always. Was a little noisy at night outside, as is on the edge of a housing estate. Would go back for sure, if the price is right

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KeighleyJetsetter
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in about 10 different Travelodges In London and this one is very good. Very quiet for central London. No noise at night, however, the Travelodge is surrounded by large tall buildings so the rooms are dark and do not get much natuarl sunlight. Not a problem as you are in London and will not be spending much time in your room. If you are travelling from Kings Cross you can get there on bus 205, takes about 20 minutes. It is a 5 minute walk from Liverpool Street station. Breakfast room very small by Travelodge standards but the food was hot and plentiful. Would stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheena K
Reviews.Content: Have just spent two days at the travel lodge. Staff could not have been more helpful. Location good for two underground stations. Very quiet location for London, rooms clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Top class for the money”
Reviews.Author: ronans
Reviews.Content: Stayed yet again in Liverpool Street Travelodge and as before could not fault this hotel. Was a bit worried that the standards may have dropped since our last visit having read some of the recent reviews but fortunately we had an excellent time. This hotel is in such a good location. Right opposite Liverpool street station making it an ideal location for sightseeing in London. The hotel is basic as they all are. Spotless clean, warm, quiet. Booked breakfast and that was excellent. Needed more towels and asked at reception and was given them without any question. Staff very friendly as extremely helpful when we asked for advise and also for booking taxis. Will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilyrose8
Reviews.Content: great location,check in staff gret (check in after 3pm)shooort walk from 2 stations.no noise clean room but bathroom needed a second clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - thats all.”
Reviews.Author: LewisBoffin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is close to Liverpool Street Station and easy to find. That is really where the advantages end. I wanted to travel light, but as the hotel does not supply toiletries needed to bring those with me. I never spoke to anyone at the hotel the whole time I was there. I had to check in on an automatic machine as there was no-one in reception (at 6pm) and just left my room card on the desk in the morning. When I first got into the room I thought that they had forgotten to put a cover on the duvet - until I realised that the duvet cover was off white. The room window looked directly into an office which was still occupied, and the shower was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: whukev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on business. The location of this Traveloge is excellent - just a 2 minute walk from Liverpool Street station so as a central base for using the underground network you couldn't be better positioned. The hotel is a standard tired travelodge in need of an upgrade, but if all you need is a bed for the night then the location makes it worthwhile. I booked breakfast at Â£7.95 for convenience, but would not recommend it. Food served in a cramped bar area and the quality was really quite poor. Overall, I would have given this hotel a 3/5 rating, but the location pushes it up to a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel near Liverpool Street station”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Travelodge. The staff were friendly and the room was clean. Check-in and check-out was straight forward although as expected you can't check in early. What surprised me though was how quiet the room. I had expected it to be noisy from reading other reviews but I guess it depends where your room is. I booked 3 months in advance for a Friday night stay as I had an exam in Westminster on the Saturday and the room only cost Â£35.

Reviews.Title: “Good for City”
Reviews.Author: 820Angel_D
Reviews.Content: stayed for a late meeting in town and hotel represents good value. Wouldnt find much better for budget price in area

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter11435
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were just staying for the night before getting a flight out from Stansted Airport. True, its basic, but at a special rate of Â£25, we could hardly complain. The staff were both friendly and helpful and although there was a slightly unpleasant foody smell, the room was both clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “very cheap very basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: bluestar1967
Reviews.Content: suitable just for a bed fr the night very very basic, take some ea and coffee with you and shower products its basically a bed for teh night when in london, location is excellent and check in staff were friednly

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: loundy1
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner recently went to London as he was attending a meeting all day so I decided to tag along and we'd make a weekend of it. We arrived at the Travelodge Liverpool Street late so we got our key from reception and made our way to our room on the 4th floor via the lift. There is only 1 lift in the hotel and we only got in once as we thought the doors were not going to open, the doors kind of stuck for what felt like forever so we decided not to take our chances in it again. When we arrived at our room we were really dissappointed especially as the room had cost Â£100 per night. It was very basic had a flickering light, grubby marks on the lamps and walls and no bath in the bathroom. We opened our curtains to see what the view was and we backed onto a housing estate that looked like something from the Bill, not the best of views! The bed was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever laid on and we got hardly any sleep over the 2 nights that we were there. I dont know if this is what is to be expected when staying in a big city like London but I certainly wont be booking to go back any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Bongebon
Reviews.Content: A very central hotel. Bargain prices, lovely hospitality, a really enjoyable stay. Would recommend as it was in a really safe area and very close to the train station. Reception staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Astronaught
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in Feb 2012. Located within easy reach of Tower Bridge. It was VERY cheap compared with other hotels so top marks for that. It was however `tired` with screws sticking out of walls, damage to the walls etc. Bed wasn`t very comfortable, but on the plus side, the room was warm. One final thing, the breakfast, also cheap, was excellent. So in summary, don`t expect a top notch hotel, but it`s more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: EdenJules
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read some of the derogatory reviews about this travelodge on this site. My husband and I stayed here last night and we were most pleasantly surprised by the friendliness and excellent service of the staff. We booked in the sale and got the room and breakfast for Â£38 for the both of us so it was amazing value given the location too. The bed was a little soft for our taste, the decoration was plain and you wouldn't choose to spend a romantic weekend there, but it does not profess to be a luxury hotel. The breakfast was varied and tasty, with fruit, cereal, yoghurt, pastries, full cooked breakfast, etc. If you want cheap accommodation in the centre of London it's all that it needs to be.

Reviews.Title: “Poor but extra rating for Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: jimhooker
Reviews.Content: The hallways smell a bit mouldy (4th floor), and the wet room floor lino was not meeting the shower so water could get in. On the second night the room heater stopped working along with a draft coming from the windows, I woke up cold. However the Location is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and helpful. If you are getting it cheap stay here - if not shell out a little more for at least a premier inn.

Reviews.Title: “basic and clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Brummig07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5min walk from Liverpool Street Station thus wonderful for getting anywhere, and super convenient if flying to Stanstead Airport. Supermarket and pubs open also in the weekend. We ate at The White Heart pub where for a good price we both had some of the best English beers and traditional English dishes, good home cooked quality. On our many visits we found the hotel always clean and the staff friendly. There is a possibility of an early (12pm) check-in and a late (3pm) check-out. Both at an extra Â£10, I think. Despite always visiting on weekends, the rooms are quiet. We could never hear the lift, maybe because it NEVER works (4 visits now in 2-3 years). There is also just one armchair in the room so if you both want to sit at the table and eat the food you ordered from downstairs etc, take turns or eat in bed.. It is fine for a short stay as the price and location are really good but, if possible, we always try to look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you must!”
Reviews.Author: 52PaulS
Reviews.Content: Back street typical Travelodge hotel, basic room, no character, the rooms really need at least a decent upgrade to take them away from their dull, bland uninviting feel and look. Outside was a highly over perfumed common hotel corridor (designed to hide some really bad smell?) and in the morning the basic breakfast only just gets pass marks. One positive point is that the staff were nice when in contact. To summarise, you certainly pay for wanting to stay in this part of the city no doubt, but in hindsight if there was a choice I should have stayed elsewhere and tubed it as necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lilosplash88
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, very basic, but can't complain because we didn't need to pay much! Restuarant was run by one man, running frantically about manning the bar and cooking everyones food AND serving the tables. Food was microwaved and heated up which was obviously quick but for the money we paid this should have been better. Was in a good walking distance to Liverpool station and the tubes. Overall, you get what you pay for with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Loriners
Reviews.Content: Great value for money - Â£49 for a double room. Reception staff were helpful and friendly. Room was clean with a comfortable bed. Quiet on a Saturday night. Only a few minutes' walk from Liverpool Station and Spittalfields Market. In the shadow of The Gherkin and on the doorstep of Petticoat Lane Market. Perfectly fine for an overnight stay. Only disadvantage was the lift was out.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and in need of refurb”
Reviews.Author: Marsbar999
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay in a tired and not all together clean hotel. I gave stopped at a number of Travelodges up and down the country and usually they are fairly similar, no frills but clean and practical. The bedroom furniture caws chipped all over, dirty walls, hairs in the bathroom etc. Not what I would expect from Travelodge! On the plus check in was easy and the location is great with only a 2 min walk to Liverpool Street Railway Station/tube. At Â£105 you are paying for the location and not the standards

Reviews.Title: “Great and Ideal”
Reviews.Author: soundzkul
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for travelling around in and around london, we were there for a long weekend stay. the hotel was basic and it the shops are quite close by if you need any thing. the tube station was only a few minutes walk and it was ideal. Great for a few days and if you want to travel around london

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Jess H
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner thought the hotel was over priced for what it is!! The lift doesnt work properly, the rooms are small and very old fashion! We found the breakfast staff really rude and we were spoken to very rudely because it had past 10am when breakfast ends and we were finishing off our coffee still, we were told to hurry up and leave else we would get locked it! As anyone would we went down to complain to the manager whos name is MILLIE and told her what had just happen when the member for staff came down and lied saying we had been rude, instead of apologising to us she was very rude towards us a sided with her team and said we should have been out by 10am.. when it clearly says breakfast served till 10am meaning you can still sit down and finish your food after 10am!(like we have in the past in all the other travelodges and not had any problems) After deciding to agree to disagree we went bak to our room.. 30mins later the police knocked on our door asking us to leave all because the manager millie didnt want us there!! We tried to speak to her and come to an arrangement as she was completely over exaggerating but she was being really cold hearted and didnt want to know! This was very upsetting for us as we had done nothing wrong but complain! We have stayed in alot of travelodge in and around the london area for the past 2months whilst looking for a rental and never had a problem.. We now have been put off going back to any travelodge because of the way we were treated!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location no problems”
Reviews.Author: lisaBelfastUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on a post New Year break. Didnt pay full price for 2 of the nights so it was very cheap. I know the area well having lived there for many years so no surprises apart from it was very quiet considering its so near the City and also the fact that like a lot of the City areas it goes quiet at night,. Great location if you want to go to the hip bars in Shoreditch and Hoxton , 10 mins walk away and only 20 mins from the West End by bus or train. You also have a lot of attractions within walking distance and it doesnt feel full of tourists or packed like the West End hotels. You get what you pay for but my room, 418 was quite spacious quiet and clean no problems with cleaning and the staff were pretty friendly . However they did run ot of pillows when the hotel was full so it was a bit much not having any extra pillows till the 2nd day! Didnt eat there so cant comment. Overall thought it was a good Travelodge and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Central location, poor quality hotel and expensive”
Reviews.Author: leadyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central to London, being a few minutes walk from Liverpool street station and less than 5 minutes walk to 'the Gerkin'. However the hotel is very expensive for the quality, and clearly the only think you are paying for is the location. I stayed here one night as a business trip, hotel was falling apart and looked like an old hospital in the corridors. This is the worst travelodge I have ever seen- I was not even given a duvet! I had to wait half an hour for the receptionist to come back as he had just dissapeared, then I was given the only duvet left, which was not fresh and clean. I would avoid this hotel is possible, as it is not up to the quality one would expect for over Â£100 a night. Breakfast was also poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a simple overnight stay, super location”
Reviews.Author: Greg3802
Reviews.Content: Hard-to-beat location to Lloyd's and the Aldgate tube station. Ideal for the experienced traveler with realistic expectations. Breakfast buffet was very good, particularly for the pre-paid price. The pre-paid wifi voucher email never arrrived; however, found the required info at the Travelodge webpage for my account (free wifi in the Cafe). Shower may be a bit tight for larger travelers, about 30"x36".

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: GoodorBadSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night this week. It's a short walk from Liverpool Street and tucked away a bit, but nothing to tricky to find. Check in was good, out of the two machines one was not working and while I was heading towards the second, a receptionist arrived and checked me in with a smile. Room was standard Travelodge, although this one is starting to look a bit tired. Due to being tucked away, there was little or no traffic noise, which made for a good nights sleep. Would use again, although possibly not my first choice, a good second!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality, good localization”
Reviews.Author: slawekg07
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good situated close to Liverpool Railway station and close to bus stops.It is perfect when you are going to Stansted airport. Hotel is old and needs rebufnishment. Carpets are old and worn. Room was not co clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a budget overnight”
Reviews.Author: bellini6
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for rail, bus and tube and Spitalfields Market is only a 5 min walk away. Bed too soft for me but that's a matter of taste. Room 202 was clean and basic but for the price good value. Unfortunate smell of strong B.O. in corridor when we arrived. And why do Travelodge staff only ever supply one set of towels when you've stated 2 people will be using the room? Had to go down to reception for extra towels which were provided speedily and with an apology. Good value overnighter.

Reviews.Title: “This is ok, for a Travelodge - very good location”
Reviews.Author: djg2018
Reviews.Content: As always, I would never pay full price to stay in a Travelodge nor stop more than one night - so on this occasion I was on a stopover before a flight and booked for Â£30 earlier in the year. That said, this hotel is pretty much ok and well located for Liverpool Street station ( 5 mins walk) ; the fabric of the hotel is usual Travelodge standard; a bit tired all over but not yet thrashed , with all the charm of "secure accomodation" , rooms are functional ( bed+shower+TV) and the bed adequate . Can't really comment on the check-in experience, as reception was unstaffed ( they were unloading a laundry truck) however the two touchscreen check-in machines worked fine and issued me with a key and room number; (the reception was staffed when I checked out). On this occasion, I didn't have breakfast Overall, this hotel does what it says on the box - good location, adequate stay, just don't pay too much for the Travelodge experience

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for and good value for central london”
Reviews.Author: deebeeLincsUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight last weekend. Arrived at midnight but the desk was manned. Clean room and actually a comfortable bed, good controllable heating and working TV - what more do you need. See alot worse in Central London. Booked for breakfast and it was edible and plentiful. The staff were all helpful and friendly. Cant understand why people complain about the lack of toiletries etc in the rooms - it is very clear when you book exactly what you get for the money, its functional! The only point I would make is that if you are a lone lady traveller you plan your route to the hotel carefully to avoid going down a dimly lit deserted alleyway to the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth 1/4th the price”
Reviews.Author: Shaat-el
Reviews.Content: This is an overpriced piece of crap of a joint. I was chargeed Â£70 for one night and they give nothing. not even shampoo or anything just soad. the rooms r like a cheap motel place which it is. small tv two cofee n tea. no mini bar nor refrigerator no microwave but an water heater. Bath is crap! Not worh it! Find a 3 star hotel with similar rates my friends

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North York Moors National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Poor location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Skygotraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on a business trip. The hotel reception is scruffy and the council tower block behind hotel looked pretty dodgy which meant I didn't want to go out after dark. The 'bar/breakfast' area looked like a youth club -didn't bother with my pre-paid breakfast. Will not say there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night in london”
Reviews.Author: star7474
Reviews.Content: Every time i go to London, i stay in the Travelodge Liverpool Street. Its situated less than a 5 min walk to the hotel from Liverpool street station/tube station. You can check in at the desk or by using the computer using your reference number so no waiting around to check in. Check in is usually 1500 but you can pay an extra Â£10 to check in at midday. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful as when myself and a friend went to our room, the kettle was missing so they moved us to another room. The location is great, bed is comfortable, room is basic but includes a tv, obviously a bathroom and towels. If you need an iron or hairdryer you have to collect it from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - But Was It OK?”
Reviews.Author: SimonTony39
Reviews.Content: Approached check in, "hello you have a reservation for me, it's Mr M" You will have to pay Â£10 extra if you want to check in now, checked time 14.25, when can I check in then, 14.30. Waited 5 minutes. Good start. Room ok, clean and functional albeit don't expect a view from the window, come to think of it no matter what room you have in this building, all you will see is a mass of concrete buildings very close on all 4 sides. There is no air conditioning and if you do open windows for some air, then you will suffer from rather busy through trafic, especially commercial vehicles. Depending on which way you go on leaving the hotel you will either end up very close to Liverpool Street which is very convenient for onwards travel to West End and just down the road from Spitefields Market with great selection of shops, antique stalls and bars and restaurant's. However if you go the other way, you will end up very close to a rather less pleasing run down area where I found myself feeling very uncomfortable walking in the daylight let alone what it would be like after dark. Facilities in the hotel are basic, small bar area and cafe, don't expect quality cuisine. but in fairness it's not that type of hotel. I felt it was more geared to back packers and it reminded me of my days spent in youth hostels abroad. Sorry to also say that the staff were rather distant, and found it difficult to understand them at times even when asking for basic information. At Â£120 per night accommodation only, puts this hotel in same bracket as more pleasing hotels with far better service, comfort and setting. So my first experience of this hotel, will be my last. I am sure that other Travelodge Hotels are better and I will if needs be try them, but my recommendation would be to seriously look at alternatives in this area of London.

Reviews.Title: “Poor place”
Reviews.Author: Wolves42
Reviews.Content: I booked in and the room had no bathroom light and a broken window. Informed reception at 7.30am and when I returned at 7pm the issues were neither fixed or recognised. the staff in the bar however are great

Reviews.Title: “Health & safety was not their main concern!”
Reviews.Author: AngelNE
Reviews.Content: Firstly I was given the key to a room that had not been cleaned, I was quickly moved to another room. The door handle of the bathroom was extermely loose, the walls were very marked and dirty and the oevrall room was run-down and didn't feel particularly clean. The worse thing was when I asked to borrow an iron (which you can only do for an hour at a time!). The iron had gaffa tape around the wire and the ironing board cover had huge holes in it. I took it back to reception and demanded they throw the iron away. I wouldn't care but it was the cheapest looking iron I've ever seen and can't believe they would risk people's safety for the sake of replacing it. At Â£110 for the night it was a complete rip-off. The only redeeming features was the excellent location and half of the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: nyatili
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property. Rooms were very clean and as usual the staff were excellent. requested room 401(stayed here last time) which is in a pretty quiet location and was lucky enough to get it. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff to deal with and Skeeter at the reception is a credit to this hotel. When in london, will definatetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but”
Reviews.Author: yizzll
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place. We got a room for disabled people because the other rooms where full. The room was very large (dont know about the normal double rooms) The room was clean. Bed was okay. I slept well. There was no noise from outside. Cleaning could be better. Bathroom was very large. We got new towels every day (4 pieces for 2 people) The location is great. 2 minutes walk from liverpool station. The hotel is in a busines area. In the weekend very quiet but from mondays a lot of people in suits getting there lunch in the little park across the street. But as you can read in the title there is a BUT. The staff was very very very rude. They where never in the lobby, you had to press a bell everytime. If you pressed it they werent very happy that you did. They where not helpfull. Not nice AT ALL. They never said hi when you came in, never said bye when you went out. Everytime I asked something they wouldnt even look at me and said I dont know. Overall a clean place, good value for youre money. Dont ask something at the staff and youre stay will be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: gilliandyson
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits from being in an excellent location, walking distance from Liverpool Street, Brick Lane and Spitalfields. There's also a really good (very busy) Italian-run cafe next door for breakfasts, and a supermarket and newsagents too. Despite the exterior of the building appearing modern and well kept, the interior is shabby and in need of some tlc. The lift was really really slow (we thought it had broken down). The room was familiar - I've stayed in a few Travelodges! Again - getting shabby, but bedding was clean and room smelt fresh. There was only one plug socket working however, and there was no mirror anywhere near a plug socket. I would recommend this hotel for business or short stay use - but not for anyone intending to spend time in the room. I want to add- why does a London hotel not have a left luggage facility? Travelodge charge a lot (as a percentage of the room price) for early check in - this is really cheeky!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgosul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Monday night, very convenient for the train station, the usual travelodge set up, basic & clean. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Tripy_777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just within 7 mins walking distance from Liverpool Street Underground station. Apparently this is the only positive aspect of the hotel. However this hotel is not bad though. You get what you have paid for. Hotel was clean and tidy. The toilet and shower room were big enough. But only 1 bulb was lit out of 2 in the toilet However there was no fridge, no iron box and no hair drier available in the room. Also no toothpaste, shampoo, shower gel and hand wash. They gave a small soap for both of us and we had to live with that. Hotel will charge you extra to serve the breakfast. They allow you to check-in only after 15:00 and check-out before 10:00, they will charge extra if you fail to do so. To summarize: If you are not very familiar with London and looking for a budget accommodation, then go for this.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jackgr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Travelodge hotels and this was in a quiet location unlike some of them. I chose this as i had an early morning flight from Stansted and the hotel is close to Liverpool st station for the Stansted Express. The menu in the bar is rather limited but there are a couple of pubs closeby which do food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheRoamingJoe
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight from Stansted one morning, so decided to stay the night before in London, with the Stansted Express train running from Liverpool Street station, this hotel made perfect sense. Typical Travelodge, arrived quite late and nobody appeared to be on reception when I came, but came soon enough when I rang the bell, I advised I would be leaving early the next morning, to which I was advised would not be a problem. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but clean and in a really great position.”
Reviews.Author: TheMrMatt90
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap hotel but it's clean and the position is really great, it's located on "The City" the financial neighbourhood, so it's quite and secure, Liverpool Street Station is really near so you're connected with the underground and the trains, there are good pubs and restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “No where near as nice as travelogde Waterloo.”
Reviews.Author: Zlm90
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms as there was 10 of us.. Each room had one towel so we all had to go ask for more. Each day we was still only provided with one towel but it wasn't much of a problem getting some more. Breakfast was okay, but the evening meal was a joke. We ordered a soup (obviously powdered) and it was far too salty to eat which came with 2 slices of hard bread not a bread roll. The nachos was fine. Garlic dough balls were Â£4 and when they came there was only 4 on the plate. We also order chilli prawns, which was supposed to come with a salad. The waiter gave us a quarter of a lemon and half a tomato and told us that was a salad. We was refunded for the dough balls and prawns. The room was okay, was a little warm at times but kept window open and it cooled down.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Great - But What Can You Expect For the Price”
Reviews.Author: ukkylie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a rather long flight. The hotel is a little difficult to find (if you don't know your way around). the staff are friendly and helpful - though they will push you to eat in their bar / restaurant. The wi-fi access is expensive (unnecessarily so) and the rooms are small, A room for 3 people included a double bed and what we thought was a pull out sofa - turns out it is just a sofa with a sheet throw over the seating area. There is no air conditioning whatsoever anywhere in the building and the windows barely open - this makes it almost impossible to sleep in summer time in London. The bathroom was not clean when we arrived - toothpaste was spilled down the front of the counter, there was also a sticky substance on the bed side table. The restaurant is outrageously over priced and there is little around the area of an evening, if you want to get a bite to eat - that isn't KFC or McDonalds / Burger King. There is a pub down the road a little and as most of the patrons usually are our on a Friday night (this is the night we stayed) you can hear an incredible amount of noise up until 1:00am - despite the windows barely being open! I can recommend it for really, really cheap accommodation but I am glad we are not staying there upon our return to London.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Travelodge, bit noisy but great location”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamMouse
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Travelodges in London. In terms of location this one is great - just off Bishopsgate and near Marco Pierre White SteakHouse . But next to a block of council flats you get noise ( I really dont care who is paying whose rent but dont want to hear it at 1 am). Staff friendly, place clean, just a bit noisy if you have the window open - which you have to if you dont want to suffocate with the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Digby98
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here in August 2011 and to be frank chose it because of the price - around Â£100 for two nights, which is good value for central London. However, a lack of ventilation to the corridors results in a stale smell and the internal noise from doors shutting was consistent. The room was small and the window handle was missing. This was fixed through use of a spoon handle but window restrictors meant little air came into the room and there was no additional ventilation. The heat was pretty unbearable, even on the cooler of our two nights, but when the window was open the drone of machinery from local buildings was constant which, along with noise of people from the street and early morning rubbish collections (before 8), meant poor quality sleep, even after having sampled Londonâ€™s nightlife. There was no bath but as with Most Travelodgeâ€™s, rooms were clean and staff efficient. Unlikely to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to go sightseeing in London”
Reviews.Author: Namruts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights august 2011, yes it's basic but for the price it's fantastic value. We had a family room and ate breakfast in the hotel everyday, the food is good with a nice choice of items but the cafe area in which you eat is not big enough which means there are not enough tables and chairs, the waitress tries to keep on top of everything but she could do with an extra pair of hands. The hotel is located in between Liverpool street and aldgate stations and can be walked to either in 5 mins. It is a basic cheap central London hotel i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Provides what it says on the can.”
Reviews.Author: Prince-of-all-men
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liverpool Street Travelodge for 5 days. It provides cheap and cheerful accommodation, a place to sleep and not much more. Others have slated this Travelodge but as we only needed a place to sleep at night with breakfast in the morning it suited us just fine. Its no frills but that is what Travelodge provides a room a bed and a bathroom. The hotel is slap bang in the middle of the financial area of London and a stones throw from the "Gherkin Building" and close enough to walk from either Liverpool St train station or Aldgate tube station. The area felt very safe even when we walked back from the station at 11pm after taking in the theatres. The staff were mostly friendly but as the hotel was packed full the evening staff were a bit rushed off their feet and when we asked for some more towels and pillows they could not get them for us (a family of 4 in a family room with only three towels and two pillows was a bit off putting). All was rectified the following day after asking a couple of more times. The bar / cafe is very small for such a large hotel and breakfast was a bit of a battle ground to find seating and a game of musical chairs, breakfast consisted of any cereal you would like tea coffee fruit juice and sausage/bacon/scrambled egg and beans each morning. Good enough to fill you up for a hard days walking around London and eat as much as you want, so you cant really complain. Variety is not on the menu. Room was showing its age a bit and had a few loose fittings and a missing light bulb but again cheap and cheerful and the bed was comfy. Would have benefited from air con as it only had a small window so was a bit warm at night . Be careful of the lift it is up 5 stairs (there is a wheelchair lift) to access it, but it has a mind of its own and seemed very reluctant to open its doors when you reached your floor, the kids thought it was hilarious. All in all it provides cheap accommodation for a trip to London and the theatres with breakfast in the morning, nothing more or less.

Reviews.Title: “OK But Basic”
Reviews.Author: Stu31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Liverpool Street Travelogue for a weekend Was OK clean and very basic room was clean but not the best Hall ways smelt damp and very warm no air to circulate Food was OK but not the best Cheap Don't think will stay again.But was cheap so did not expect much

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch !”
Reviews.Author: HJA63
Reviews.Content: we booked 2 rooms at the same time, they put 1 of us on 1st floor & the other on 6 ! Apparently they don't automatically put you together when you book together; luckily I hadn't taken the children ! The boiler was going all night & then we awoke- not that I slept , to NO hot water. There was only 1 bath towel in the room. Our room was changed & the nights stay refunded, we were then put on floor 1, a lot better but still only 1 towel. Room was clean but with cracked sink & terrible bed in which we spent the night rolling into the middle .Poor Travelodge, very poor

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideSam
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, maids come in everyday with fresh towels and refill tea + coffee. Room only has a tiny window so it did get very hot with 2 adults and 2 children sleeping in the same room needs air con or ceiling fan ! We had breakfast and tea in the hotel food was lovely the chef is friendly and fast, it takes abit of time trying to order food as the lady is abit dizzzy but nice, there was one night my husband was still ordering the food for 4 of us, he hadnt even paid for it and the chef had put the food on the table ! Again the lady at breakfast is nice just dont expect her to rush to give you ur breakfast plate. You need to give her your room nimber then you will be given your breakfast plates, just know one tells you this ! The lift broke while we was there but it was fixed the same day. Before we arrived the hotel had, had a leak on the second floor ( our floor) so the landing didnt smell very nice but they got cleaners in to clean the carpet and it helped with the smell. They acted fast on anything that went wrong i cant knock the hotel for that.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: deank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for for a night whilst going to see War Horse, on entrance it does look tired but once in and being greated by some of the nicest, welcoming and friendly staff we have ever experienced really, really made up for it. Every member of the team were so happy and it really showed they enjoyed there job. Ok, its not the ritz, but nor is the price. I would and will deffintly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and does the job”
Reviews.Author: Marse86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Liverpool Street Travelodge as I often do when in London and I personally think it is always fine. It is not the Hilton, and you won't get anything above a bed, a toilet, and a shower, but what more do you need? Always find the rooms to be clean, and big (anytime I have stayed in Liverpool Street, other Travelodges wouldn't let you swing a cat). Very near Liverpool Street Station, and for the price you can get it at, I would recommend. If you only want a place to sleep at night, then this is just fine. It does get a bit warm at night though, could do with better air con.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Tones-and-Sue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last year around general election time. The room reminded me of student accomodation, it was dated with a poor quality bed. The shower was dated but this was a good thing - it was really powerful unlike the the newer water saving ones! Getting breakfast was a pain, each day we had to go to reception to purchase a breakfast voucher which we then handed in at the restaurant - a funny carry on! No complaints about the brekfast itself though. Greeat location - a short walk to Liverpool Street station and close to the Gherkin. If you get a good rate it is worth staying, but if you are paying full price, as we did, then it is worth paying a little extra and staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rhymas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel overnight and would not recommend to anyone who is looking for a short budget break. The bathroom had cockroaches in and in the morning when we informed them they didnt hessitate to give us a 50% rebate. When we got home we decided to write a e-mail of complaint... We were informed that in no uncertain terms thst we were not being believed and when i sent a e-mail back saying i still wasnt satisfied with there response they informed me that unfortunatly they had investigated and the matter was now closed.A large company with terrible customer complaints ... terrible

Reviews.Title: “hotel needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: ThelmaandLouise50
Reviews.Content: I know this is part of a budget chain but I have stayed in other Travelodges that are much better than this. Only one staff member at reception at busy check in times causing long queues.. Carpet in room dirty. Light bulbs and sink plug missing (when complaint was made we were told that these problems could not be rectified as there was no maintenance engineer at weekends). The only solution would be to move to another room but this one had similar problems. Piles of dirty linen left in corridors. Tables in restaurant area all needed clearing. Plates for cooked breakfast only handed out on request and staff were not always there to hand them out so people queueing. This hotel would be fine if there was any sort of management to deal with problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly a great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: DBenedict
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I stayed here for one night so I could attend a meeting the next day. The hotel is located virtually next to Aldgate tube station which is perfect for getting into the heart of London. Aldgate East is a five minute walk around the corner if you want to use that one instead. On arrival, the receptionist was a bit narky with me as he couldn't find my booking even though I gave my name three times, each time spelling it for him but, instead of listening to me, he just ignored it and got more annoyed. Eventually he found it and I got room 315. It was easy enough to get to the room, lift or stairs, and the room was very clean and tidy (a lot better than the Farringdon I stayed in last year) and everything worked. The only grippe was that the shower sprayed everywhere! Even with the shower curtain in the cubicle, it still got on the floor but not a major issue. The other problem was that there are some bars close by which got very busy. This was a friday night so it may be different on other nights of the week. Anyway, this is good if you want a night out close to the hotel but if you want a good sleep then it might hinder it as a lot of noise could be heard. The bed was more comfortable then expected though! So, the room itself was great but the receptionist and the loudness brought it down a bit. The price won it for me and if you were going for a short break then it might be a great option with the closeness of the tube and price.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller078
Reviews.Content: Was apprehensive after reading a mixed bag of reviews. But booking late, at the rate my company would pay and clashing with an event in London, this was all I was left with. Very close to Liverpool St but when reading the directions on their website replace Virgin store with Tesco Express. Pleasant staff on reception. One of the refurbished Travelodges (done in the blue decor like the TV advert). Check in and check out very quick and none of that nonsense about taking a card swipe for extras. Vending machine with sweets, pop & water at reception. Found the room clean, fittings all clean and in good working order, bathroom (only shower) clean apart from shower curtain that trailled in slow draining shower tray which showed the classic signs of not being able to dry out properly. Good shower and plenty of hot water. With it being in the financial district very quiet after dark so got a good night's sleep. The only gripe I have is that the mattresses in Travelodge don't have a protector on them - best not to dwell on that! Room could have been on the warm side if outside was one of those hot sticky nights as no visible sign of fan etc but window did open (with safety restraints) so probably not too much of a problem. Corridors might give wrong impression of a place in decline but this is what Travelodges are about - no frills. Plenty scuff marks but with the probably high turnover only to be expected. Breakfast hit the mark for me although I don't partake of the cooked stuff - yoghurt, grapefruit, toast, cereals and they have Earl Grey tea! Help yourself so can't grumble. Plenty of pubs and eating places in short walk distance - we went up to Spitalfields Market which offered loads of choice (mostly chain type) but other independents on offer on streets surrounding location - depends on your price target. All in all, changed my opinion of Travelodge and after saying I would never set foot in one within London again, I would return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Happy staff -) & good value for money”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has a really good location to the sites and transport link's (Liverpool st less than 10 minutes away) the staff are friendly and helpful. The room is a standard Travelodge room, which was clean and basic. It did have a kettle and tea making facilities though. There is also a cafe on the first floor. There is a cafe next door that does a variety of really good traditional breakfasts, now it is not fancy but if you are looking for a good filling cooked breakfast this is the place to go. If you want cash point facility there is one at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, basic but clean - just what you expect”
Reviews.Author: MariaNExeter
Reviews.Content: Always a bit of a gamble, especially with such mixed reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Room as you would expect - basic but comfortable and clean; also quiet which was a bonus. Unfortunately no cold water so reported it at 12.00 and receptionist thought it was just a washer needed replacing and said she would get someone to fix it - how efficient we thought. Only to return at 2330 sans eau. Receptionist said he would get us a jug of water which didn't materialise so husband had to go down again and requested some bottled water out of the machine. After a little negotiating, this was delivered free to our room 5 mins later - a room change at this time was not on the cards! All in all though, we were pleased with the service and location. Price a bit steep at Â£107

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and bed comfortable”
Reviews.Author: belanger500
Reviews.Content: This is in the Financial district, bed are comfortable, bring your shampoo and amenities as not included for Travelodge. Breakfast available and easy check in and checkout. Elevator. This is a 3 stars hotel but my stay is always comfortable and consistent.

Reviews.Title: “quite sressed under presure”
Reviews.Author: mantabr0ther2
Reviews.Content: we had a pleasant stay here for two nights when we arrived the man on the front desk was fantastic as we had travelled down from norwich by train we booked two rooms and one early check in we knew we were two early but as we were there for such a short time we asked if he had one room ready we could leave our bags in he rand around the hotel and sorted this he was fantastic he was called silvester. breakfast on the first morning was ok but they had no sausage left by the time they came for me the rest of our party was finished not the same saturday morning though there were no fruit juice glasses no bowls no ceral the chap i charge looked so stressed they know how many people have booked breakfast surely this can be sorted better

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: ScottiePaul
Reviews.Content: Pretty basic travelodge, could do with a paint and a new carpet but for a short stay in the centre of London it was fine. Easily reached from London Liverpool Street and plenty of restaurants and bars round about.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, basic minimum service”
Reviews.Author: Senex81
Reviews.Content: The hotel has pared down its services to an efficient basic level. Check-in is simple. The room was clean, but with only one set of towels, one extra pillow, one small soap and two plastic cups. The light over the sink was broken. I suppose Â£100 a night for bed only is what you have to pay for budget accommodation in the City, but it felt like a minimum level of customer service. It must be worth having shares in Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Needed!”
Reviews.Author: littleme21
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner decided to book a few days in London towards the end of May 2011, start of June 2011. We wanted a good base for exploring London, a central hotel that didnt cost too much and the Travelodge Liverpool Street provided that. This hotel is in a great location, it is literally 5 minutes walk from Liverpool Street Station, across the traffic lights and down the street. It is central to the tube/train stations and a number of eateries and bars. The member of staff on reception during check in was friendly..He provided us with a map of London and recommended some places to eat. We got checked in quickly and up to our room. The room, as with all Travelodges, is basic, but clean and tidy. The room was cleaned everyday for our 3 nights stay. The room was extremely warm at night and we did need to leave the windows open, which did result in some noise from outside. However I know the Travelodge cannot be held accountable for what happens outside the hotel. The room was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and other than the temperature, I could not fault it. We were in the hotel bar just once, again this was basic, but clean and tidy. The staff manning the bar were friendly and cheerful, however did not have much knowledge about prices of drinks, they did have to go and find another member of staff. The carpet was also slightly sticky. Bar service is maybe something to be improved on but we didnt spend much time there, so cant really say a lot. We didnt eat at the hotel either, so cant comment on that. Overall, we had a relaxing and enjoyable break in London. The hotel was everything, I expect clean, comfortable and friendly staff....I would recommend it to friends and if was visiting London again, wouldnt hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a University Campus Dorm”
Reviews.Author: selinabaybee
Reviews.Content: I went to stay at the hotel with my boyfriend for a one nights stay because we was planning to go out for my birthday in central london and we liked the transport links in Liverpool street so we stayed here.... DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL!! 1. It is in a corner alley way kinda road secluded from the main street and is kinda intimidating to walk through at night time. 2. When we got there they said they didn't have are names booked on the system and forced us to spend money on the hotel computer cafe to log on to my hotmail to show proof, after we showed proof on the computer of our email confirmation we did not get any apology from the receptionist for the misunderstanding. 3. The hotel needs alot of work from the reception up to the rooms the corridors to the room are stuffy and have a mild scent of B.O 4. the room is basic and the shower had rusting and fungus in the corners I wish i took a picture to show everyone. 5. receptionist are very unhelpful 6. THE VIEW OF THE HOTEL IS OPPOSITE A OFFICE I didn't realise till after when I had finished showering that I can see the office people who could have potentially seen me naked!!!! I WILL NEVER NEVER GO THERE AGAIN i am not fussy I have been to other travel lodge hotels and was satisfied I was not expecting a hilton hotel but this should be a 1 star hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: sbarrett91
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this travel lodge me and my partner decided to 'risk it' and take advantage of a Â£30 room on a sunday night in May. We don't expect much from a travelodge room given the prices we pay however we do expect the room to be clean. We were 'greeted' by a receptionist who treated us as an inconvinence which wasn't a good start! Upstairs in our room we had a 'complimentary' magazine that had obviously been left by the previous customers and some sweets all over the dressing table. Not a good start really. On checking the bedsheets were stained with what looked like blood and the pillows with black smears which looked like oil/grease. The walls were even dirty in places I didn't know they could get dirty! Off I go to 'brave' the bathroom and I find half a bar of used soap on the floor of the shower - didn't fancy washing my hands with that! We sorted out what we could and slept after getting in from a night in chinatown (worth a visit if you're in the area!). We had a fairly good nights sleep, a bit stuffy but after having the windows open for a bit we realised that the drunks would not let us sleep like that! There are currently roadworks going on so if you decide to stay here use the aldgate tube stop not the liverpool street one! On checking out we complained but were not understood by the staff - something to do with our strong somerset and bristolian accents maybe? I will be sending a letter instead! I wouldn't recommend this travel lodge to anyone visiting london however I would recommend the snaresbrook travelodge and also the Kingston upon Thames travelodge! Worth noting that we werent brave enough to eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, but a bit frayed around the edges”
Reviews.Author: cazzzie987
Reviews.Content: We needed an affordable hotel for one night in London. At Â£80, this Travelodge fits the bill. It's only a few minutes from Liverpool St station, so getting there isn't taxing. Sadly, if anything lets it down, it's the standard of decor in the rooms; nothing major, but our room could have done with a refit - veneer was peeling off the bedside table, the walls were in dire need of a repaint and the bathroom was a bit tatty. Not the end of the world, though and if you're after somewhere to lay your head at an affordable price in Zone 1 then you could do much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: edinburghandglasgow
Reviews.Content: Cheap cheerful good enough room Interesting location near to Petticoat Lane and Spittalfield Market lots of place to eat round the University Near to tube and easy journey from Kings Cross/Euston. A little bit tricky to find from tube so check map but once found takes only a few minutes to walk to Aldgate or to Liverpool Street station.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: UsernameNotFound
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel anywhere, I always book to stay in a travelodge and I've never been disappointed. That's not to say I was disappointed this time, but I wasn't as happy as I could have been. I travelled to London for a birthday weekend with three of my friends. We decided to book two rooms, and because we arrived early, we checked into one room earlier but did't check in to the other one until 3pm (which is fine, I knew this already). What I was disappointed with was that out second room was about six floors above our first room! I was under the impression that if I book more than one room, they would be together? Apart from that little problem, any travelodge is a nice place to stay! Of course it's basic, but it's perfect for those who just need a few hours sleep while spending the rest of your time out and about exploring the wonderful city that is London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Suitable for short stays, Extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Eleanorfayelucy
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, beds and linen were clean, you pretty much get what you pay for. It is basic, but suitable for all customers (I visited with my boyfriend and used it as a place to just rest our heads after being out and about in London). Great location and really short walking distance to more than one tube station. The staff couldn't do enough to help me when i left my ipod in my room and was unable to return to london to collect it. They kept in contact with me about the post and were genuinely really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough if you aren't expecting too much”
Reviews.Author: Dirne72
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a Travel Lodge so you know what to expect. Tidy and clean but basic and functional room. A bed, TV tea and Coffee making kit thatâ€™s all you want or need out of a place like this. The window in my room did lack a handle so at first I couldnâ€™t open it (on the hottest day of 2011 so far) but thatâ€™s when the tea and coffee making facility came in handy as I managed to use the spoon as a makeshift handle and jimmied the catch open. Bath room worked, water worked and there were plenty of clean soft towels. Breakfast was in a small cafÃ© type of room on the first floor, self service with everything you could want really. Have to especially say that the guy on reception was friendly with a big smile was pleasant to deal with both in booking me in and serving breakfast with the same big smile!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: salbot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend. The hotel was clean and the rooms were fine. The bed was really uncomfortable which caused us to have a bad nights sleep - it was so bouncy, whenever one of us moved it woke the other up! The shower tray filled up when taking a shower. Overall it is a cheap option in London - the location is great. 2 mins walk from the tube. Oh - note to hotel - tell your staff to lay off the hard sell on the breakfast! We should only have to say once that we don't want to buy breakfast. We were bombarded with reasons to buy breakfast about 4 times! We said no the first time.

Reviews.Title: “the stay was great, easy, no problems affordable”
Reviews.Author: steven080
Reviews.Content: A good place, central, near station, close to London city Centre, no noise, seems safe, affordable with good service and assistance, very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get excited about”
Reviews.Author: stanlion
Reviews.Content: All around the hotel, and in our room, there were lovely little pictures of people sleeping peacefully and contentedly - the implication being that the hotel is so comfortable and quiet, you will soon be drifting off into Nodland. A shame, therefore, that the windows are only single glazed and that London, even in the City at the weekend, never really goes quiet. Whilst my earplugs ensured I got a fair bit of sleep, there were plenty of drunks outside shouting to ensure that both I and my partner were frequently disturbed. The room itself was clean, the bed and pillows just about passable but it all felt pretty basic - well that's a Travelodge, I suppose. I had no contact with staff at all and felt I would have been hard pressed to find someone had I needed them. I have stayed in luxury hotels elsewhere in the country for less than this and had breakfast. It is pretty poor that so many hotels seek to charge you an extra extortionate amount for a few bits of egg and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but functional, just!”
Reviews.Author: taichichick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is considerably more shabby than it was just six months ago for my last visit. Toilet bowl was cracked, broken tiles in shower were grotty and dangerous, bedroom window didn't close properly so cold and noise were problems. Breakfast was unappetising, with scrambled eggs that looked like they were from a dried egg mix, and rubbery greasy bacon.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: DontCareAboutName
Reviews.Content: Another Travelodge that didnt let you down on the companies promise - simple, affordable rooms. Dont expect a marriott or hilton and you'll be happy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting place - avoid it”
Reviews.Author: JuWe
Reviews.Content: On checkin the "system" was down, so an employee who had no idea had to let us (a group of about 15 people who wanted to check in) wait until someone who had an idea would arrive. Luckily, this person arrived about 20 minutes later................ So checkin into room 201 happened then. Room was quite small and with basic furniture (that has seen better times already). A very soft mattress on a bed, that made squeaking noises on every slightest move, but contrary to that the pillows were solid as rock. Same was the thick limescale that was residing in the kettle, as it was on the bathroom facilities. But the worst was the black mould that was resident in the shower - wins the price for the most disgusting feature in the room. As I had paid in advance (never again with a travelodge, big mistake) I tried to sleep, but on a Saturday night it seems its a place where drunken idiots and noisy cars seems to be present all night....... Location is good ( close to Liverpool Station and Brick Lane entertainment venues), but I would only return if they burn that whole place down and rebuild it - and not let it be managed by travelodge again. Most disgusting place that I have stayed in for a long long time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst budget hotels I've ever stayed in - terrible”
Reviews.Author: jumpingjon1975
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of different classes of hotel and in terms of condition and service this has to rate one of the worst! The room was one of the first on the corridor and the door kept banging all night with people returning to their rooms - Room hadn't been cleaned properly - A light bulb was missing from the bedside table - The remote control missing from the TV, to the extent a sticker was placed stating 'Please access the TV manual, apologies for no remote control'. (pretty much impossible as the channels are set up so far apart!) - Staff at the desk were unhelpful - No shampoo, shower gel and no assistance from the front desk - instead they offer things you don't actually need to be helpful Amusingly the website suggests they offer a great service 'Weâ€™re not in the business of disappointing' (well they went out of your way when I visited), 'which is why at Travelodge we now have over 360 hotels offering everything you need for business' (couldn't really be further from the truth, a wash in the morning is fairly essential in modern times) 'simple hassle free accommodation' 'Travelodge helps you feel better off not only in your wallet or purse but also by helping you to make your life a little simpler and less hassle'

Reviews.Title: “Badly maintained rooms”
Reviews.Author: Richie1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a cheap option as only wanted a bed for the night. Tried to check in earlier as we were going out in London for the day but were told we would have to pay Â£10 early check in fee before 3pm-not a good start! I haven't stayed in a Travelodge for several years and it would appear that this hotel has given up on providing basic clean rooms which is how I would have described the chain. I stayed in room 102 Positive points - The bed was actually pretty comfortable - Decent location Negative points - The carpet was filthy -visble dirt especially nr the bathroom entrance. - Bedside lamp not working-not even a bulb inside it! - No tv remote control - No toiletries (not even soap fixed to the wall) - Bathroom surface was badly stained near sink - Bathroom taps would not turn off! You had to twist them hard to try and turn them off it felt as though they would come off the basin. Overall a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable. Value For Money.”
Reviews.Author: pajawa
Reviews.Content: I was put off by previous reviews before and so stayed at other hotels. However this time we decided to "give it a go". I was surprised by the friendly welcome, clean rooms, breakfast and little to no external noise. While walking throughout the hotel to leave and return we come across cleaning, restaraunt, and porter staff who where ever so friendly. The service was something you'd get from a 4 star! Yes, we could find a few problems but nothing that affected our stay. We will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Parisfox
Reviews.Content: The day after I stayed here I said to someone 'we just stayed in an awful hotel in London' and they answered, without prompting, 'Was it the Travellodge in Liverpool street?' Ok, so lets state the advantages first- it's cheap and it's central. So of course one expects no thrills. I was surprised that they had a policy of charging Â£10 for 'early check-in' if you arrive before 3pm. As there were 3 of us we booked a family room which is supposed to be able to accommodate 4. When we got up to the room it was only made up for 2 people. When we enquired they said if there are more than 2 people in the room the additional guests have to make up the beds themselves. Ok, but this didn't explain why there was only enough cups and towels for two people. I was one of the two people who was supposed to sleep in the main double bed but it was quite simply the most uncomfortable bed ever so I ended sleeping on the floor. The hotel was cold and there was a lot of street noise. Personally I wouldn't be inclined to stay here again. It was like the RyanAir of Hotels. I think if you stayed more than a few nights you'd be inclined to throw yourself out the window!

Reviews.Title: “The most uncomfortable bed EVER”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Cup_Cake
Reviews.Content: I know this is a budget option, but I still think you should actually be able to SLEEP. The double bed in our family room was AWFUL (room 525 - if you get this room, ask to move!): springs sticking through and uneven. In the end my partner tried to sleep on the floor under his coat! We also were not impressed that, despite booking a family room for 3 people, the room was only equipped for 2 when we arrived: had to go down to reception (no phones in rooms) to collect ourselves extra towels, mug, duvet, pillow. Finally, we arrived at 2.40pm and were told we could not check in as we had not purchased "early checkin"!!! (checkin is at 3pm). C'mon.... It's not like we were trying to get access at 10am. All in all, a thoroughly unpleasant experience. Definitely would not stay there again. I stay in budget hotels a lot and this was by far the most uncomfortable night I've had in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “After all complaints : a surprise”
Reviews.Author: Truffles21122010
Reviews.Content: I have read more complaints than I liked, but on arrival and during our stay there for ten nights I am more than pleased. The rooms were clean, new clean towels every day, no traffic-noice at all, the hotel is in between office buildings and there was no noice from neither Bishopsghate nor Houndsditch /Aldgate. Safe area as there are no dodgy places/ pubs etc nearby. Staff: friendly, nice, helpful - one of the receptionists even speak German! We were recognized already shortly after check-in. Sorry - all complainers - I have got no complaints - a budget hotel is a budget hotel and if someone complains about a soap - o dear - buy it at Liverpool Street Station. By the way - there WAS a piece of soap in the bathroom !!. And I do know - I am going to stay there again next time London is on my schedule !! All the best to you all in Harrow Place !! Happy New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TerryMWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: As per other reviews, surely you should get a bar of soap in the bathroom and be able to deal with staff who can speak English. I can honestly say that this is the worst hotel that I've stayed in within the UK. For the money, I wish that I'd got a train home !

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTourist
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the London Liverpool Street Travelodge for the third time. If I'd paid attention to some of the reviews on here I'd probably never have booked it at all. At the end of the day it is what is - a Travelodge! We got a good price for our 3 night stay. The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Liverpool Street Station. The staff we encountered on check-in and during our stay were friendly and helpful. The room was fine, again it is a Travelodge so if you book a Travelodge you know what you'll get. The room was clean, comfortable and fairly quiet. You will need to bring your own hair dryer. There are of course slight issues with the room - i.e. the bathroom taps were stiff and noisy, there was a slight crack in the basin and don't get me started on the shower curtain..... however the bathroom was clean and perfectly adequate for our needs. What else can I say? If you want somewhere reasonably cheap (for London), easy access to transport or walking distance to Brick Lane, Shoreditch, etc, then give it a go and make your own mind up.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: MrAKW
Reviews.Content: I booked this "hotel" as its close to the office and I thought it'd be good value for money if basic. As it turned out Â£98 for the night without breakfast even when booked a couple of weeks in advance. The room on the 3rd floor was scruffy at best with poor decor, bulbs missing from light fittings and a less than average bathroom with similar decor. The window didn't shut properly so there was street noise throughout the night. On booking in I found a large pile of used sheets and towels just outside my bedroom door and this was still there the following morning when I checked out. We'd joked in the office about this "hotel" charging by the hour and my stay didn't do much to change this opinion. Only when leaving did I put rubbish in the bathroom bin to discover that it hadn't been emptied from the previous guest's stay and still contained a used condom and soiled sanitary towel. The "hotel" itself is in a poor condition - the lift left me wondering whether we'd make it to the 3rd floor. All I can say is never, ever again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff”
Reviews.Author: nicolast
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2.45pm and the man behind the desk was very rude and would not let us check in till 3pm. I asked to print something out and was sent on a wild goose chase to Liverpool Street station! Did not manage to get it printed. It comes across here that the staff dont like their job! After check out I realised id left the Sat Nav at the side of the bed when I rang up to ask them to put it to one side and id go back I was told there was no Sat Nav in the room. I assured them 100% there was and exactly where it was. I am yet another person who has been robbed from at this hotel (see previous reviews)

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge..Just Fine for What Its Meant To Be!!”
Reviews.Author: WILLYONE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night, i was attending the Brandon Flowers gig at The HMV Forum but as i was returning to Norwich from Livepool Street thought i'd stay close by so as not far to go in the morning. Got the room for Â£29 plus i added the breakfast for Â£6.50 which is normally Â£7.50 but if you book on line you get a quid off! All in all i have to say that i found it to be just fine. Got checked in quickly, was given my breakfast voucher and after being told about breakfast times etc i was soon on my way to my room. The room was an average size, very basic but clean which is the major thing we all want. Small LCD TV..The remote didn't work as one or two others have said, but there are buttons on the top of it so it can be worked manually! Bathroom ok..Toilet, Shower...not much else!!!! No smellies..be warned!!! But i guess i'm the same as numerous others and always take their own anyway. Security wise..You need your key to access the rooms and lifts etc which is good. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Liverpool Street Station so can't see any issues there! Breakfast was good..Nice selection of hot and cold items. You can have as much as you want! Room not very big so there could be problems at certain times! Generally i was very happy to stay here..Would i stay for longer? Originally i probably would've said no..But after staying there i think i could! All in all suprisingly impressed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable budget option”
Reviews.Author: longliein
Reviews.Content: Three cut-price stays have all satisfied. A touch battered but meets basic needs for comfort & cleanliness, peaceful mornings at weekends. Great location minutes from Liverpool St. Staff always friendly & efficient & happy to dole out extra tea bags and milk. Always been able to push the checkout time back an hour or so without asking. Handy convenience store around corner in Middlesex St, great if pricey breakfast options in nearby Spitalfields.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experince ever - no running water and exceptionally rude staff”
Reviews.Author: B6NG6C6T
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room at London Liverpool Street Travelodge arriving in August 2010. I was booked into a double room on my arrival and tried washing and cleaning my teeth before retiring to bed. Unfortunately the cold water was not working. Hoping that this would resolve itself by the morning I went to bed. I awoke at 7:30am to have a drink of water, shower, shave and clean my teeth. Again there was no cold water and very nearly scalded my self using the hot tap. I wanted to ring reception to ask for some cold water to be bought up and for some reason Travelodge do not have telephones to reception in any of the rooms. I had to get dressed and traipse down to reception without having washed which was very embarrassing when encountering fellow residents. I explained the situation to the receptionist and asked for some cold water to drink and wash with. I was first told I had to buy bottled water from the vending machine and would also have to move rooms onto a different floor until finally she suggested I could visit the restaurant to obtain a glass of water. She finally found an unoccupied room on the same floor which whilst it had a bed with a broken foot I could use the washing facilities. I then has to transfer all my luggage to this room in order to shower and shave, despite the fact that the room was not made up with scum marks all round the sink. I would have thought that the provision of running cold water was a basic service at any hotel and whilst I understand that sometimes things do not always work I was surprised this was not reported by the staff when the room was last made up. I was also dismayed that Travelodge don't provide a phone to reception and/or complimentary bottles of water to accompany the coffee and tea making equipment unlike comparable establishments. The service and initial attitude of you staff was second rate and despite complaining to the manager and in writing I have not been offered an apology or refund.

Reviews.Title: “Loud buzzing noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: BIRCHYBOY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the weekend of the London Tattoo Convention. We picked this hotel as it stated it would be a short walk to Tobacco Docks... this was not true as it took about 50 mins! And also we were bringing our own car so needed to park it somewhere for the whole weekend. We were advised that there is a 24hr carpark costing Â£10.00 per day just around the corner. This closed so had to drive back to the hotel to get help on where to park!! The gentleman on recepton had to contact his friend to find this out. After parking our car we got back to the hotel to check in after ringing the bell for 20 mins a man turned up. The room was clean and tidy the bed was very comfortable. We stayed in Room 618!! Which must be above the boiler room as we were disturbed during the early hours of the morning with a loud noise!!! That seemed to go on and off for a long time. We payed extra for breakfast in the morning which was stone cold!! When telling the lady in the breakfast room that it was cold she replied "ohhh sorry" .... and nothing more! When we checked out, the staff on reception were very nice.. We then had another blow when we went to pay for the carpark!! it cost us Â£70.00 !! not Â£10.00 per night as stated it would be.... We will not be returning to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: ennismore
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£32 a night and it was clean, comfortable and quiet. Couldn't find the TV remote so couldn't get the TV to work. Didn't ask about that as wasn't all that fussed about it so can't say how efficient they would have been about getting it sorted. All in all well satisfied for what I paid, Stayed at travelodges on City Road and on Kings Cross Road and thius was far quieter which was good

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for price paid”
Reviews.Author: RCK09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, booked as a bargain for Â£25 a room and had more good reviews than bad (lots of London T/lodges have very bad reviews) however we did find it a bit of a trek from St Pancreas as a Â£15 taxi ride. Checked in about 10 at night after a long trip from Paris with two young children and while reception were friendly in spite of prebooking our baby cot they had no room set up ready for us. So at 10 oclock at night we did find it a little annoying that after the long trek to our room we then have to wait for the cot to be brought to us and then have to make it up ourselves. Our "family" room was also quite small and a bit of a struggle with the cot and extra bed made up (again had to do this ourself) and only one towel between us all, at this time of night I couldnt be bothered to trek down to reception to get more. My Dad also had a family room and his was much larger than ours with more towels so I pinched one from him. However for Â£25 I feel happy with what we got, the room had a modern tv, was clean, comfy beds and fairly quiet. Room noise was minimal however workman did seem to start on the building opposite just before 7 am and this was quite noisy. However I was quite pleased making it to 7am in central London with no other noise. Also had breakfast for Â£7.50 each and the kids ate free which we thought was good value. Food fine and a good selection however it was left to one person to keep replenshing and serving and he seemed rushed off his feet. Overall a bargain for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheap (with advance booking)”
Reviews.Author: CDM52
Reviews.Content: Hotel and area around was quiet on a holiday Monday. Hotel was in a new building but inside showed lots of wear and tare / damage in public areas and room. Check in was friendly. Room was normal Travelodge standard. Hotel has a small bar restaurant but this had closed early.

Reviews.Title: “Two sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: KirstyHenderson
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and after doing so I would not recommend it to anyone. The overall cleanliness was not very good, the doors to the rooms and lifts were very noisy and you can hear everything that is going on in the street below. Although the location is quite good, I would not stay here again as I basically paid Â£200 to have 2 of the worst nights sleep ive ever had.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgigi
Reviews.Content: I loathe travelodge BUT this one came up trumps.
